Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Vase
Description: Vase with a flat base, elongated oval-shaped body without a neck, with a thinned lip that is the continuation of the body. The clay is coarse and common and very friable as a result of the rare organic temper, which nonetheless has numerous white mineral particles. It has been polished and covered with light brown paint, whereas the orifice is surrounded by a wide red ochre stripe.
